content.description: Sit start with a right hand palming around the arete and a left hand two-finger edge on the face. From there, bump the right hand up to sidepull, do the same with the left hand, reach the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pad will work. It has a perfect landing.
content.location: It climbs the south side of Park n' Play's southeast arete.

content.description: Sit start with a pair of small crimps and pasted feet. From there, bump through a small left hand crimp to a good rail above, match on it, then finish up the remaining edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad. The landing doesn't get much better.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Park n' Play.

content.description: Stand start with a pair of edges about six feet off the deck. From there, work straight up through edges to reach a mantel finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The immediate landing is great, but there is a rock behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Park n' Play.

content.description: Sit start with a small left hand crimp, a decent right hand crimp, and poorly pasted feet. From there, reach a left hand two-finger sidepull pocket, gain a right hand crimp, cruise up the remainder to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Park n' Play.
